title: Cozy witch-life sim Witchbrook is delayed to 2026 'to ensure the world feels rich, immersive, and alive'
summary: As a consolation prize, developer Chucklefish revealed a new interactive map of the town of Mossport.
body: Witchbrook , the upcoming cozy life sim about going to witch collegeโthink Stardew Valley meets Harry Potter except you're a witch instead of a wizard, and no, I'm not clear on the distinctionโhas been delayed. After setting a release window of winter 2025 earlier this year, developer Chucklefish now says it needs more time to get things done, and that means a launch sometime in 2026. โDespite great development progress this year, weโve made the difficult decision to shift the release into next year,โ Chucklefish wrote in a development update . โWitchbrook is a big projectโand itโs taking shape exactly as we hoped; full of charm, depth and detail! In our first blog , we shared our goal to create a living, breathing world for you to explore, and as we bring all those elements together, weโre taking the time needed to ensure the world feels rich, immersive, and alive.โ Along with the usual bustle of getting things ready โbug fixes, polish, that sort of thingโChucklefish says the added development time โhas opened the door to exploring a few additional exciting opportunities, including additional platforms and language support we hadnโt initially planned.โ Details on that will be revโฆ
